content.description: The following question refers to the topic of Protestant reform and religious conflict.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why Protestant reformers such as Martin Luther stressed the use of vernacular (non-Latin) languages for religious texts and instruction?

choices.label: Most of the early Protestant reformers had little or no knowledge of Latin.
They were pressured by secular rulers to discontinue the use of Latin in favor of local languages.
They believed that religious teachings should be directly accessible to as wide an audience as possible.
They wished to covertly spread their teachings in languages less likely to be understood by the Catholic clergy.

content.answer: They believed that religious teachings should be directly accessible to as wide an audience as possible.
